info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 7:13PM EDT until April 24 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following counties, in east central Indiana, Fayette, Union and Wayne.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 713 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Richmond, Connersville, Centerville, Cambridge City, Hagerstown, Dublin, Glenwood, Franklin, Waterloo, Bunker Hill, Abington, Brownsville, Milton, Greens Fork, East Germantown, Economy, Mount Auburn, Jacksonburg, Beesons and Mettel Field.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Fayette, IN; Union, IN; Wayne, IN
